column5: Hi. I don‚Äôt have much advice to offer but two days ago I started my recovery (again lol) from my ED and also alcohol dependency. It‚Äôs been two days with no drugs, no alcohol, no binging, no purging. Please take care of yourself and know that you aren‚Äôt alone. Recovering from an ED is hard enough but when you add alcoholism or drug dependency to the mix too, the emotions you experience are a complete rollercoaster. I genuinely believe recovery is possible. I wish I had more advice but I‚Äôm right there with you. Know that you are loved and supported

Tbh I just feel like I relate a lot to her (lmao)... people say she‚Äôs horrible and they make fun of her and stuff but BED and food aggression/obsession/addiction have driven me to do things that are beyond my natural personality and moral compass. She might just be awful but I just see so much of myself at my worst sometimes in her videos it gives me a lot to reflect on. I look at the way she lies and my eating disorders have driven me to lie CONSTANTLY to so many people in my life... whether it‚Äôs telling people I‚Äôve eaten or not eaten or not binged or not purged. It‚Äôs just relatable in a weird way I guess... it‚Äôs hard to explain

Edit: THAT BEING SAID she‚Äôs done some really awful and inexcusable things that have nothing to do with ED or food addiction

Hi üíó I‚Äôm very proud of you! I know this may be unsolicited advice but please read if you wish to :) getting help may seem like an embarrassment and a shameful process but these things rarely just evaporate. If your ED is driving you to the point of suicide please consider going to talk to someone you trust and a professional. It may seem miserable but if your life is on the line it‚Äôs worth it. There is no shame in getting help, therapy, or medication. I was about your age when I started Vyvanse, a medication that is known to help with binge eating (I‚Äôm not saying that you should take it but it‚Äôs an option). Of course everything is different depending on the person but please greatly consider seeing somebody for your ED or at least talk to somebody that may be able to help. There is so much you have ahead of you and I am so proud of you for continuing.

Thank you for taking the time to respond to me. I was spiraling awfully and I woke up and read this and it made me feel loved and that things will be okay. Thank you for being so kind and know that you made a huge difference to me, I‚Äôm so grateful

Thank you thank you thank you for your response. I was in an awful place and I genuinely didn‚Äôt think anyone would read or respond to anything I wrote. Reading what you wrote made me not feel so alone and that‚Äôs really all I could ever ask for. I know it may seem odd but it really made a difference to me and I‚Äôm so grateful

Thank you so much for your reply. I was in a really bad place and you don‚Äôt realize how much it helped that somebody just read what I wrote and actually took time to respond. Words can‚Äôt describe how grateful I am and I just want you to know how much of a positive impact you had on a strangers life. Thank you so so much

There‚Äôs no reason she should‚Äôve said anything, even if you did put on weight. It‚Äôs not her place, it never was her place, and it will never be her place to have any input. She was being a horror show and it has nothing to do with you. I know it hurts a fucking ton whenever someone does this shit even if you know you shouldn‚Äôt care about their opinion. I‚Äôm sorry you had to deal with this ‚ù§Ô∏è

Just New York and Vanderpump Rules. It‚Äôs so bizarre. Like it‚Äôs immediately when I turn it on. I could be watching cooking shows or something and not want to eat but if I turn on RHONY I go into a frenzy lmao
This is so weird but whenever I watch Real Housewives of NY I sudden feel like I need to eat. Like specifically that show. It makes me want to eat bread and I have no idea why. Every. Single. Time.
Thank you for your reply, it‚Äôs just been rough lately especially with the holidays. I‚Äôm sorry to hear about your ex, I hope you find peace and love ‚ù§Ô∏è

I love buying and making super fear foods for people... my boyfriend is stick thin no matter what he eats and I go crazy with the stuff I make and get for him. I have no idea why. I think food is kind of like a love language to me, sadly. So my way of showing affection is by feeding people I care about a shit ton of food that I think will make them happy.

I used to do it a lot and honestly I think the biggest thing you should be aware of is that it‚Äôs absolutely disordered eating. It‚Äôs not a healthy behavior. I don‚Äôt think there are a lot of negative health consequences physically but you just feel like shit. It‚Äôs just not conducive to a happy life and for me it always led to purging or long periods of starving. It was always kind of a medium I did before going to another extreme. It‚Äôs also just not very sustainable.

This is just from my experience. I just think you should be aware that it‚Äôs still a serious matter even if there aren‚Äôt a ton of blatant health consequences. If you need to talk I‚Äôm here :)

I used to be the same way and sometimes can still fall back into it. One big thing is I had my bf stop sharing his location. It was too hard. I would check constantly and it only got me in trouble. The other thing I started doing was accepting that he will not contact me until he‚Äôs home safely. That way I don‚Äôt have to wait around my phone all night in case he texts me while he‚Äôs out. I go play video games or do whatever I wanna do and then he always calls me at the end of the night. I feel like the more I forced myself to be laid back about it, our relationship grew a lot and he started taking initiative to help me feel secure and validated. Also before he goes out we just kind of have a quick convo about what he‚Äôs gonna do and with who, I say ‚Äústay safe and I love you‚Äù and then he goes off.

I still have my moments but it really is possible to become more okay with it over time. It is rough tho and I totally get it, I‚Äôm right there with ya lol ‚ù§Ô∏è
Yes thank you!!!! Thank you so much for your reply, today‚Äôs been a rough one lol üíñ‚ù§Ô∏è
You got this. I‚Äôm glad the post had some kind of positive impact. If you ever need someone I‚Äôm here. It‚Äôs hard but we get through it day by day. We can do it ‚ù§Ô∏è
Fuck that dude man... you dodged a major bullet. Here for ya babe ‚ù§Ô∏èüíñ

Lots of love to you ‚ù§Ô∏è thanksgiving is an ED trigger central ugh. 

It‚Äôs always hard on the holidays to see so many people with all of the things that bpd has made difficult (having close relationships, etc). It really wears on you. I hope you have lots of warm snuggles with your pup :) if you ever need someone to talk to I‚Äôm here üíñ

For me, I spend so much time with people that don‚Äôt suffer from an ED that communities like this make me feel like I‚Äôm not hopeless and alone. It sucks going through everyday just feeling like nobody understands it and that nobody cares enough to try to understand. I know I‚Äôm sick and I know I have to get better and I really am trying, even if this community did make me forget how sick I was, I wouldn‚Äôt mind forgetting once and awhile that I‚Äôm fucked up lol

I was about to make this exact post. The Office, Parks and Rec, Bobs burgers are my big three. I think it‚Äôs just really comforting and safe I guess? Like it‚Äôs kind of quiet gentle humor and has a family atmosphere.

So my boyfriend actually knew I had BPD before I did... he did research on it but never really told me but encouraged me to talk to professionals in general because I expressed how frustrated I was with my emotions. In the meantime he researched how to support people with BPD and looked into it so he could understand me a bit more. I finally told him I have bpd and we got on the same page. Idk if I would‚Äôve preferred him to just tell me as soon as he suspected it. I think what he did was really good though and it really did work. It meant a lot to me that he looked into it so much and was so considerate with how he approached it.
My cat passed away last week and I‚Äôm still a mess... this post is so sweet. I‚Äôm glad you have her ‚ù§Ô∏è

Hi friend! So I pretty much have the exact same situation as you. I have a long distance relationship with my boyfriend and I absolutely HATED when he went out. When I tell you hate I mean like I went through intense bouts of paranoia and panic every time he‚Äôd go out. 

I realized that it‚Äôs so toxic for me to demand that he stays in just to FaceTime me or something like that. I decided that I was just going to start encouraging him to go out when he expressed that he wanted to. When he‚Äôd go out I would just play video games or something that I enjoy to distract me. Eventually you get used to it. I still have episodes of panic when he goes out and I‚Äôll say stupid shit like ‚Äúdon‚Äôt cheat on me,okay?‚Äù But at the end of the day I‚Äôm progressing. I know it doesn‚Äôt sound helpful but the absolute best way to deal with it is to just deal with it. Whenever you feel anxious about your partner going out, just do something to distract yourself and fight the feelings of needing validation at that exact second. It‚Äôs really fucking hard but it‚Äôs so worth it. You‚Äôll give in to the irrational thoughts once in a while but everyday is a new opportunity to be better.

I‚Äôm here for you if you need support or anything because like I said I went through (and still sometimes experience) what you‚Äôre going through now.
You missed the prequel ‚ÄúI Just Sent 20 Texts In a Manic Episode and Now I‚Äôm Laugh Crying In The Shower‚Äù
Oh I‚Äôm right there with you. The definition of putting all of my *very fragile* eggs in one *very precarious* basket.
‚ÄúYou Have Other Friends? I Guess I‚Äôm Not Enough For You‚Äù

I kind of slapped together this post and didn‚Äôt think anyone would actually see it and the amount of people that relate to it makes me feel comforted. I hope everyone that reads this finds what they‚Äôre looking for in themselves. We all deserve love.
sometimes you just have to sit back and laugh at how big of a mess life can get lol

Spoiler: the poem was not good
The P stands for perceiving every minuscule action as someone not liking me anymore so I might as well give up on trying to put in effort

Trust me, I go back and forth in believing I actually contribute to the lives of the people I love. If you ever need to talk I‚Äôm here :)

I think it‚Äôs sweet that you make a thoughtful effort to apologize. Everyday is a journey, especially with BPD, it can feel like it‚Äôs almost out of our control. However, you‚Äôre important and you are not a burden. Convincing ourselves that we are just an inconvenience to everyone around us just pushes us to hate ourselves more and lash out at others more. It‚Äôs a vicious cycle. You‚Äôre loved and you are strong. You. Are. Not. A. Burden. ‚ù§Ô∏è
Happy birthday!!!

I go through periods where I just get hyper hyper paranoid about cheating or random abandonment from my boyfriend. It lasts like a few days where I just need constant reassurance for things I already know. It used to be all the time but I‚Äôve made a lot of progress and it normally only happens about once a month. I have your back, friend :)
Hi, I believe in you :)

Yea he‚Äôs very aware and it‚Äôs something we both deal with on a day to day. Tbh I‚Äôve really progressed a lot and have gained a lot more control over my emotions than before so our relationship has really grown over time. You‚Äôre absolutely right though
This is the mentality that gets me out of those paranoid phases but I still sometimes slip up and let it take over lol. Everyday is an adventure lmao

What I‚Äôm talking about is a compulsive paranoia. I was raised surrounded by infidelity. I‚Äôm not attracted to anybody physically until I‚Äôm attracted to their personality and the reason for a lot of my paranoia is realizing that really anybody can cheat regardless of their perceived character. Shit happens and people fuck up. My issues with trust has nothing to do with the man I‚Äôm dating, it has everything to do with me.

I have an amazing, loving, loyal boyfriend that deserves all the trust in the world and is the first person that I do believe loves me unconditionally. However, I still have phases of this manic paranoia of potential cheating. My rational brain knows that it‚Äôs not reasonable and that worrying about hypotheticals is useless but I‚Äôm not perfect so my rational brain doesn‚Äôt always win. 

My entire original post is irrational and unhealthy but in a moment of weakness it‚Äôs what I felt and I feel like this is a safe space where people can see this kind of stuff and relate and support.

I went from anorexia to bulimia to binge eating disorder, I have quite the range under my belt lmao. I totally get what you mean, I‚Äôm always overdoing it no matter what side. Overeating or starving. Sometimes I feel like I‚Äôll just never have a healthy relationship with food but I know I can‚Äôt give up. Everyday is a struggle but it‚Äôs well worth it.

This shit is tough. It just is. It‚Äôs a perpetual cycle of feeling not good enough. Sometimes it actually makes you feel subhuman or like an animal that literally lacks the biological mechanism to eat appropriately. It hurts. 

Remember you are in control, even if it doesn‚Äôt seem like you are. You have the ability to form healthy relationships with food. It‚Äôs possible. I don‚Äôt have a ton of advice but I can offer my love and support just as another human being going through this journey as well. You can do this and I believe in you ‚ù§Ô∏è

My Hero Academia is absolutely amazing. I watched when I was really depressed and weirdly it actually gave me some kind of hope. It also has a lot of light hearted and comedic moments so it doesn‚Äôt get too heavy. Please watch ‚ù§Ô∏è

It's hard for me to talk myself out of this. My fear isnt even that my boyfriend will cheat, it's that I'm worried that he'll stumble upon somebody that he can't help but fall in love with so he will leave me for them. It took me a long long time to actually realize that I'm the one that he wants and that I'm worthy of feeling secure. I still have my moments, and we are currently in a long distance relationship so that really doesnt make it any easier, but i know the way he looks at me is unique to only me and i know that he knows i'm irreplaceable to him. I feel like BPD consistently leaves many of us feeling like we are basket cases and that we don't deserve the partner we have. We all deserve love and loyalty and to feel safe :) it's a long process to learn how to manage these feelings but it is definitely worth the journey.

Yea I realized I had a problem when I had a legitimate anxiety/panic attack because I was scared I was going to be framed for murder or something like that. Just a bunch of weird shit that I would worry about all the time lol. The severe paranoia reduced dramatically once I was in a lower stress environment but I would definitely see somebody!

So I was prescribed Vyvanse for ADHD and I‚Äôm not sure how much it‚Äôll help BED. I found basically that it made me lose appetite for about 8 hours and then I would become absolutely STARVED. I actually think my BED kind of originated from that pretty much. 

Of course I‚Äôm not a medical professional or anything and it might be super helpful for BED but that‚Äôs just my personal experience. It will very likely curb appetite while you‚Äôre on it tho, id just be mindful about what happens when it wears off. Not sure if this is helpful at all but best of luck to you :)
That‚Äôs a great point. I can‚Äôt thank you enough ‚ù§Ô∏è

I‚Äôm excited to try it! If you don‚Äôt mind me asking, do you ever find it difficult to assign a percentage chance for something? I feel like I wouldn‚Äôt be able to quantify a realistic percentage or putting a number to it would just make it seem like ‚Äúoh so there actually *is* a chance...‚Äù I don‚Äôt mean to criticize this technique or anything I was just wondering if you ever have had a problem with this :)

This is AMAZING advice... seriously I thought it was a shot in the dark posting this here cause my original post was such a mess but this seriously is wonderful advice. I can‚Äôt thank you enough üíñ

This happens to me a lot. I think mine is mostly related to anxiety but if I think about anything upsetting or potentially triggering while I‚Äôm eating I‚Äôll instantly become nauseous or vomit. I also have a history with eating disorders tho so maybe it‚Äôs related to that for me. When I‚Äôm really down I can‚Äôt keep food down or I‚Äôll take a couple bites and just feel absolutely sick and have to stop eating

Honestly this might not be the right thing to say, but I struggle with terrible social and general anxiety and my boyfriend has helped me by pushing me to do what I‚Äôm uncomfortable with socially. He tells me that I just have to give it a try and he always tells me that he has a back up plan if things get awkward or if I‚Äôm really uncomfortable. For example, I was panicking about socializing with his roommates and neighbors and he sat me down and said that I have to go out and at least try and if I don‚Äôt like it we can leave and go see a movie. I went out and we had tons of fun. He was with me throughout it, but now I‚Äôm comfortable socializing with them without him. I‚Äôm not sure how she‚Äôll respond to being pushed but personally that helped me. Keep in mind he did it in a loving way and was always near enough to be there if I needed him so it wasn‚Äôt like I was just thrown into it. 

Sorry if this isn‚Äôt what you were looking for but this is what my boyfriend did to help with my anxiety. You‚Äôre a good person for caring so much and trying to help!

I was majorly right one time and I‚Äôm still trying to get over it. It‚Äôs really tough. I‚Äôve gotten better about taking things as they come and trying not to over analyze every word (or lack thereof). 

What makes me stop worrying so much is reminding myself that what‚Äôs happening is happening and if someone is pulling away, who am I to stop them? If they want out of my life then they probably aren‚Äôt best to be present in my life, and if it‚Äôs just in my head then it‚Äôs in my head. I distract myself with other stuff and usually whatever I‚Äôm feeling passes. It‚Äôs tough af to get over it tbh but I just remind myself that constantly hounding someone about not pulling away only can drive them to pull away, it‚Äôs not healthy for anybody. The concept of abandonment is so harrowing but the world keeps turning and life goes on. Sometimes I just tell myself that when people pull away it makes more space for me to learn how to love myself better :)
Ah this is amazing advice thank you so much!! Do you have any hobbies that you particularly find helpful?
Thank you so much, it‚Äôll be rough but I‚Äôm optimistic :)
Thank you so much, this was really nice to read :)
Thank you!!! I feel amazing, thank you so much for your support!
